授業方法: In the spring semester, there will be weekly seminars on Japan's development followed by a series of study of global issues. In the fall semester, we will examine major issues facing the 21st century. By the end of Fall Semester, all students must  submit 3-4,000 words research paper followed by oral presentations. Seminars may be delivered in classes and online.

第1回: Introduction to the Course & Defining Research Objectives and Significance
Read this syllabus and understand the structure and requirements of this seminar course.
第2回:
Research Topics and Significance/Modern Japan Literacy
Research: How to define research topics and significance.
Literacy: The Opening of Japan and Meiji Restoration

1. Propose three possible research topics and their significance.
2. Explain reasons and impact related to the opening of Japan and Meiji restoration in English.
3. Watch Documentary in URL 1 below
第3回:
Group workshop: "Militarism in Modern Japan"
Research: Group Workshop
Literacy: Militarism in modern Japan

1. Narrow down to one research topic together with well-defined significance.
2. Explain the rise of militarists in modern Japan, taking count of of level-of-analysis problems in international relations.
第4回:
Rational Actor Model: "Japan's Attack on Pearl Harbor" & "US Attack on Hiroshima and Nagasaki"
Research: The Use and limit of Rational Actor Modeal
Literacy: Pearl Harbor ＆ Hiroshima/Nagasaki

1. Understand the use and limit of rationality in political science.
2. Apply a rational actor model to explain an attack on Pearl Harbor and Hiroshima/Nagasaki and understand its implications.
3. Watch URL 2 below
第5回:
Myth and Reality: The Making of Postwar Constitution and Revision Debate
Research: Myth vs Reality
Literacy: Understand Decision-making to attach Pearl Harbor and Hiroshima/Nagasaki

1. Was the postwar Japanese constitution made and imposed by the Allied Powers?
2. Increase an understanding of image and reality in political debate and advance critical thinking skills.
第6回:
Subjectivity and Objectivity in Analysis/Allied Occupation of Japan
Research: Understand how social sciences can be value-driven
Literacy: Understand and explain the Allied Occupation and its impact on postwar development

1. Was the American Occupation successful? Why/why not?
2. What is the impact of the Occupation on postwar Japanese development?
第7回: 1. Was the high economic growth of the 1960s a "miracle"? If not, explain its causes, employing major paradigms of political economy.
第8回:
Contending Paradigms of Political Economy 1
Research: Understand analytical, methodological and normative orientations of major paradigms of political economy: Pluralism
1. What paradigm of political economy best explains the Japanese system of high economic growth?

第10回:

第11回:
